Package forsale

Interface Strategy

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    NullStrategy, RandomStrategy
    public interface Strategy
    The interface for describing strategies in "For Sale". A strategy must be able to make a bid in an auction (including passing), and must choose a card to play in a sale.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int bid​(PlayerRecord p, AuctionState a)
      Makes a bid for a player given the state of the current auction.
      Card chooseCard​(PlayerRecord p, SaleState s)
      Chooses a card for a player in the current sale.

    • Method Detail

      • bid

        int bid​(PlayerRecord p,
        AuctionState a)
        Makes a bid for a player given the state of the current auction. A return value less than the current bid (or more than the player's cash) indicates that the player is dropping out of the auction. In practice, a strategy would be "attached" to a particular player, but the player is attached as a parameter to allow for thinking about "what would different strategies do in the current state?"
        Parameters:
        p - the player
        a - the state of the auction
        Returns:
        the bid

      • chooseCard

        Card chooseCard​(PlayerRecord p,
                SaleState s)
        Chooses a card for a player in the current sale. It is expected that this will be a card which the player holds! If this contract is violated the game management system can choose any one of the player's cards in an arbitrary manner.
        Parameters:
        p - the player
        s - the state of the current sale
        Returns:
        the card which that player will sell in this sale.
